newsitem.title: INDIA: India domestic air passengers at 12.8 mln in 95/96.
newsitem.headline: India domestic air passengers at 12.8 mln in 95/96.

text.p: India's domestic air carriers carried 12.8 million passengers in 1995/96 (April-March) up from 12 million in the previous year, a government statement said on Wednesday.

"The domestic passengers carried by Indian Airlines and private air taxi operators increased by 62 percent from 1990 to 1995 (from 7.4 million to 12 million). In 1995/96, this reached to 12.8 million," the statement said.
India opened its domestic airline industry to private firms as part of an ongoing economic liberalisation programme launched in 1991. Indian Airlines is owned by the government.
